edu.uci.ics.crawler4j.robotstxt

Class UserAgentDirectives

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.uci.ics.crawler4j.robotstxt.UserAgentDirectives

  • public class UserAgentDirectives
extends java.lang.Object
    The UserAgentDirectives class stores the configuration for a single user agent as defined in the robots.txt. The user agent string used depends on the most recent User-agent: definition in the robots.txt file.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(java.lang.String rule,
                java.lang.String value)
        Add a rule to the list of rules for this user agent. Valid rules are: sitemap, crawl-delay, host, allow and disallow. These are based on the wikipedia article at: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robots_exclusion_standard and the Google documentation at: https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/6062596
        Parameters:
        rule - The name of the rule
        value - The value of the rule

      • checkAccess

        public int checkAccess(java.lang.String path,
                       java.lang.String userAgent)

      • getCrawlDelay

        public java.lang.Double getCrawlDelay()
        Return the configured crawl delay in seconds
        Returns:
        The configured crawl delay, or null if none was specified

      • getPreferredHost

        public java.lang.String getPreferredHost()
        Return the specified preferred host name in robots.txt.
        Returns:
        The specified hostname, or null if it was not specified

      • getSitemap

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getSitemap()
        Return the listed sitemaps, or null if none was specified
        Returns:
        The list of sitemap-links specified in robots.txt

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()

      • isWildcard

        public boolean isWildcard()

      • match

        public int match(java.lang.String userAgent)
        Match the current user agent directive set with the given user agent. The returned value will be the maximum match length of any user agent.
        Parameters:
        userAgent - The user agent used by the crawler
        Returns:
        The maximum length of a matching user agent in this set of directives
